uses: The unbelieving receive the external sign or sacramentum; but the believing receive in addition, although invisibly, the reality represented by the sign, the res sacramenti.
They fit, feel and move invisibly with your body and are so velvety soft they are a pleasure to wear.
However, even on these cruise ships, you will find that the cruise lines have cleverly and invisibly divided the ship into adult and non-adult areas.
The lens piece itself is lightweight and designed to sit almost invisibly on the face, and the arms of the frame sport a python-like finish.
It features a unique v-front for tantalizing coverage, and a no-lace, no-lines design for wearing invisibly underneath your curviest fashions.
These winged creatures, probably winged lions with human faces, resembling the sphinx, formed a chair on which Yahweh was invisibly enthroned.
definition: In a way that can not be seen; in an invisible manner.
